      throws RepresentationException
        Description copied from interface: Representation
        Returns a value, or throw a RepresentationException if it's not found.

        Usually, the method will return a String or a Number, but if this Representation implements also Mapper, then get() could return a complex object.

        Use #getValues() to return a collection

      • merge

        public Representation merge(java.lang.String keyForCurrent,
                   java.lang.String keyForNew,
                   Representation representation)
        Description copied from interface: Representation
        Build a new Representation containing this representation along with the representation parameter Say we have a User, its userRepresentation and we want it merged with its schoolRepresentation

        userRepresentation.merge("user", "school", schoolRepresentation) will give : { user : {id:12, name:"Jo"}, school:{id:3, name:"Harvard", price:40000} }

        Specified by:
        merge in interface Representation<com.google.gson.JsonElement>
        representation - Representation to merge
        Returns:
        a new merged Representation

      • addToArray

        public Representation addToArray(Resource resource,
                        boolean eager)
        Description copied from interface: JsonRepresentation
        Add a new element ( even if one of the same key exists) to the representation. It pushes a value if the current Json Element is a Json array. If it does not exist, the array is created. If it exists and is not an array, we throw an exception. In XML, the rule is different. If eager is used, then resource.getRepresentation() must be 'compatible' with this Representation. The best compatibility is of course the same class, but this may depend on the implementation. Suppose we have a Topic with User and Comments, each comment have a User We want to add a Comment to the Topic add comments eagerly: { user :{id:12, name:'jo'} comments:[ {id:1, content:"Hello from Jo", user:{id:12, name:'jo'}}, {id:2, content:"Hello from Jack", user:{id:13, name:'jack'}}, ] } add comments not eagerly { user :{id:12, name:'jo'} comments:[ {id:1, content:"Hello from Jo", user:12}, {id:2, content:"Hello from Jack", user:13}, ] }
        Specified by:
        addToArray in interface JsonRepresentation<com.google.gson.JsonElement>
        eager - : if false, Resource dependencies will show only their ids
        Returns:
        the updated representation

      • addToArray

        public Representation addToArray(java.lang.Object value)
        Description copied from interface: JsonRepresentation
        Add a new element. In Json, to an array, in Xml to the current node
        Specified by:
        addToArray in interface JsonRepresentation<com.google.gson.JsonElement>
        Returns:
        the updated representation

      • pluck

        public <T> java.util.List<T> pluck(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                          java.lang.String key)
                        throws RepresentationException
        Description copied from interface: JsonRepresentation
        Pluck extracting a list of property values.

        From Underscore.js documentation :
        var stooges = [{name : 'moe', age : 40}, {name : 'larry', age : 50}, {name : 'curly', age : 60}];
        _.pluck(stooges, 'name');
        => ["moe", "larry", "curly"]

        Specified by:
        pluck in interface JsonRepresentation<com.google.gson.JsonElement>
        Parameters:
        type - type of returned elements
        Throws:
        RepresentationException - if the current Representation is not a JsonArray
